   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: -module(ei_decode_encode_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include("ei_decode_encode_SUITE_data/ei_decode_encode_test_cases.hrl").
   26: 
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   28:          init_per_testcase/2,
   29:          test_ei_decode_encode/1]).
   30: 
   31: suite() ->
   32:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   33: 
   34: all() -> 
   35:     [test_ei_decode_encode].
   36: 
   37: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
   38:     rand:uniform(), % Make sure rand is initialized and seeded.
   39:     io:format("** rand seed = ~p\n", [rand:export_seed()]),
   40:     runner:init_per_testcase(?MODULE, Case, Config).
   41: 
   42: %% ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   43: 
   44: % NOTE: these types have no meaning on the C side so we pass them
   45: %       to C and back just to see they are the same.
   46: 
   47: 
   48: %% ######################################################################## %%
   49: 
   50: test_ei_decode_encode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   51:     P = runner:start(Config, ?test_ei_decode_encode),
   52: 
   53:     Fun1  = fun (X) -> {X,true} end,
   54:     Fun2  = fun runner:init_per_testcase/3,
   55:     Pid   = self(),
   56:     Port  = case os:type() of
   57:                 {win32,_} ->
   58:                     open_port({spawn,"sort"},[]);
   59:                 {unix, darwin} ->
   60:                     open_port({spawn,"/usr/bin/true"},[]);
   61:                 _ ->
   62:                     open_port({spawn,"/bin/true"},[])
   63:             end,
   64:     Ref   = make_ref(),
   65:     Trace = {1,2,3,self(),4},			% FIXME how to construct?!
   66: 
   67: 
   68:     BigSmallA = 1696192905348584855517250509684275447603964214606878827319923580493120589769459602596313014087329389174229999430092223701630077631205171572331191216670754029016160388576759960413039261647653627052707047,
   69:     BigSmallB = 43581177444506616087519351724629421082877485633442736512567383077022781906420535744195118099822189576169114064491200598595995538299156626345938812352676950427869649947439032133573270227067833308153431095,
   70:     BigSmallC = 52751775381034251994634567029696659541685100826881826508158083211003576763074162948462801435204697796532659535818017760528684167216110865807581759669824808936751316879636014972704885388116861127856231,
   71: 
   72:     BigLargeA = 1 bsl 11111 + BigSmallA,
   73:     BigLargeB = 1 bsl 11112 + BigSmallB,
   74:     BigLargeC = BigSmallA * BigSmallB * BigSmallC * BigSmallA,
   75: 
   76:     send_rec(P, Fun1),
   77:     send_rec(P, Fun2),
   78:     send_rec(P, Pid),
   79:     send_rec(P, Port),
   80:     send_rec(P, Ref),
   81:     send_rec(P, Trace),
   82: 
   83:     % bigs
   84: 
   85:     send_rec(P, BigSmallA),
   86:     send_rec(P, BigSmallB),
   87:     send_rec(P, BigSmallC),
   88: 
   89:     send_rec(P, BigLargeA),
   90:     send_rec(P, BigLargeB),
   91:     send_rec(P, BigLargeC),
   92: 
   93:     %% Test large node containers...
   94: 
   95:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
   96:     TXPid = case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
   97:                 4 -> mk_pid(ThisNode, 1 bsl 27, 0);
   98:                 8 -> mk_pid(ThisNode, 1 bsl 27, 1 bsl 31)
   99:             end,
  100:     TXPort = mk_port(ThisNode, 268435455),
  101:     TXRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [262143, 4294967295, 4294967295]),
  102: 
  103:     send_rec(P, TXPid),
  104:     send_rec(P, TXPort),
  105:     send_rec(P, TXRef),
  106: 
  107:     [begin OtherNode = {gurka@sallad, Creation},
  108: 	   send_rec(P, mk_pid(OtherNode, 32767, 8191)),
  109: 	   send_rec(P, mk_port(OtherNode, 268435455)),
  110: 	   send_rec(P, mk_ref(OtherNode, [262143, 4294967295, 4294967295])),
  111: 	   send_rec(P, mk_ref(OtherNode, [262143, 4294967295, 4294967295, 4294967294, 4294967293])),
  112: 	   void
  113:      end || Creation <- [1, 2, 3, 4, 16#adec0ded]],
  114: 
  115:     %% Full 64-bit pids
  116:     [send_rec(P, mk_pid({gurka@sallad, 77},
  117:                         rand:uniform(1 bsl Bits)-1,
  118:                         rand:uniform(1 bsl Bits)-1))
  119:      || Bits <- lists:seq(16,32)],
  120: 
  121:     %% Full 64-bit ports
  122:     [send_rec(P, mk_port({gurka@sallad, 4711},
  123:                          rand:uniform(1 bsl Bits)-1))
  124:      || Bits <- lists:seq(24,40)],
  125: 
  126:     %% Unicode atoms
  127:     [begin send_rec(P, Atom),
  128:            send_rec(P, mk_pid({Atom,1}, 23434, 3434)),
  129:            send_rec(P, mk_port({Atom,1}, 2343434)),
  130:            send_rec(P, mk_ref({Atom,1}, [262143, 8723648, 24097245])),
  131:            void
  132:      end || Atom <- unicode_atom_data()],
  133: 
  134:     send_rec(P, {}),
  135:     send_rec(P, {atom, Pid, Port, Ref}),
  136:     send_rec(P, [atom, Pid, Port, Ref]),
  137:     send_rec(P, [atom | Fun1]),
  138:     send_rec(P, #{}),
  139:     send_rec(P, #{key => value}),
  140:     send_rec(P, maps:put(Port, Ref, #{key => value, key2 => Pid})),
  141: 
  142:     [send_rec(P, <<16#dec0deb175:B/little>>) || B <- lists:seq(0,48)],
  143: 
  144:     % And last an ugly duckling to test ei_encode_bitstring with bitoffs != 0
  145:     encode_bitstring(P),
  146: 
  147:     runner:recv_eot(P),
  148:     ok.
  149: 
  150: encode_bitstring(P) ->
  151:     %% Send one bitstring to c-node
  152:     Bits = <<16#18f6d4b2907e5c3a1:66>>,
  153:     P ! {self(), {command, term_to_binary(Bits, [{minor_version, 2}])}},
  154: 
  155:     %% and then receive and verify a number of different sub-bitstrings
  156:     receive_sub_bitstring(P, Bits, 0, bit_size(Bits)).
  157: 
  158: receive_sub_bitstring(_, _, _, NBits) when NBits < 0 ->
  159:     ok;
  160: receive_sub_bitstring(P, Bits, BitOffs, NBits) ->
  161:     <<_:BitOffs, Sub:NBits/bits, _/bits>> = Bits,
  162:     %%io:format("expecting term_to_binary(~p) = ~p\n", [Sub, term_to_binary(Sub)]),
  163:     {_B,Sub} = get_buf_and_term(P),
  164:     receive_sub_bitstring(P, Bits, BitOffs+1, NBits - ((NBits div 20)+1)).
  165: 
  166: 
  167: 
  168: %% ######################################################################## %%
  169: 
  170: % We read two packets for each test, the ei_decode_encode and ei_x_decode_encode  version....
  171: 
  172: send_rec(P, Term) when is_port(P) ->
  173:     P ! {self(), {command, term_to_binary(Term, [{minor_version, 2}])}},
  174:     {_B,Term} = get_buf_and_term(P).
  175: 
  176: 
  177: get_buf_and_term(P) ->
  178:     B = get_binaries(P),
  179:     case B of
  180:         <<131>> ->
  181:             io:format("(got single magic, no content)\n",[]),
  182:             {B,'$$magic$$'};
  183:         <<131,_>> ->
  184:             T = binary_to_term(B),
  185:             io:format("~w\n~w\n(got magic)\n",[B,T]),
  186:             {B,T};
  187:         _ ->
  188:             B1 = list_to_binary([131,B]),	% No magic, add
  189:             T = binary_to_term(B1),
  190:             %io:format("~w\n~w\n(got no magic)\n",[B,T]),
  191:             {B,T}
  192:     end.
  193: 
  194: 
  195: get_binaries(P) ->
  196:     B1 = get_binary(P),
  197:     B2 = get_binary(P),
  198:     B1 = B2.
  199: 
  200: get_binary(P) ->
  201:     case runner:get_term(P) of
  202:         {bytes,L} ->
  203:             B = list_to_binary(L),
  204:             %%io:format("~w\n",[L]),
  205:             % For strange reasons <<131>> show up as <>....
  206:             %	    io:format("~w\n",[B]),
  207:             B;
  208:         Other ->
  209:             Other
  210:     end.
  211: 
  212: %%
  213: %% Node container constructor functions
  214: %%
  215: 
  216: -define(VERSION_MAGIC,       131).
  217: 
  218: -define(REFERENCE_EXT,       101).
  219: -define(PORT_EXT,            102).
  220: -define(PID_EXT,             103).
  221: -define(NEW_REFERENCE_EXT,   114).
  222: -define(NEW_PID_EXT,         $X).
  223: -define(NEW_PORT_EXT,        $Y).
  224: -define(NEWER_REFERENCE_EXT, $Z).
  225: -define(V4_PORT_EXT,         $x).
  226: 
  227: -define(OLD_MAX_PIDS_PORTS, ((1 bsl 28) - 1)).
  228: 
  229: uint64_be(Uint) when is_integer(Uint), 0 =< Uint, Uint < 1 bsl 64 ->
  230:     [(Uint bsr 56) band 16#ff,
  231:      (Uint bsr 48) band 16#ff,
  232:      (Uint bsr 40) band 16#ff,
  233:      (Uint bsr 32) band 16#ff,
  234:      (Uint bsr 24) band 16#ff,
  235:      (Uint bsr 16) band 16#ff,
  236:      (Uint bsr 8) band 16#ff,
  237:      Uint band 16#ff];
  238: uint64_be(Uint) ->
  239:     exit({badarg, uint64_be, [Uint]}).
  240: 
  241: uint32_be(Uint) when is_integer(Uint), 0 =< Uint, Uint < 1 bsl 32 ->
  242:     [(Uint bsr 24) band 16#ff,
  243:      (Uint bsr 16) band 16#ff,
  244:      (Uint bsr 8) band 16#ff,
  245:      Uint band 16#ff];
  246: uint32_be(Uint) ->
  247:     exit({badarg, uint32_be, [Uint]}).
  248: 
  249: 
  250: uint16_be(Uint) when is_integer(Uint), 0 =< Uint, Uint < 1 bsl 16 ->
  251:     [(Uint bsr 8) band 16#ff,
  252:      Uint band 16#ff];
  253: uint16_be(Uint) ->
  254:     exit({badarg, uint16_be, [Uint]}).
  255: 
  256: uint8(Uint) when is_integer(Uint), 0 =< Uint, Uint < 1 bsl 8 ->
  257:     Uint band 16#ff;
  258: uint8(Uint) ->
  259:     exit({badarg, uint8, [Uint]}).
  260: 
  261: pid_tag(Creation) when Creation =< 3 -> ?PID_EXT;
  262: pid_tag(_Creation) -> ?NEW_PID_EXT.
  263: 
  264: enc_creation(Creation) when Creation =< 3 -> uint8(Creation);
  265: enc_creation(Creation) -> uint32_be(Creation).
  266: 
  267: mk_pid({NodeName, Creation}, Number, Serial) when is_atom(NodeName) ->
  268:     <<?VERSION_MAGIC, NodeNameExt/binary>> = term_to_binary(NodeName),
  269:     mk_pid({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number, Serial);
  270: mk_pid({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number, Serial) ->
  271:     case catch binary_to_term(list_to_binary([?VERSION_MAGIC,
  272: 					      pid_tag(Creation),
  273: 					      NodeNameExt,
  274: 					      uint32_be(Number),
  275: 					      uint32_be(Serial),
  276: 					      enc_creation(Creation)])) of
  277: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
  278: 	    Pid;
  279: 	{'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  280: 	    exit({badarg, mk_pid, [{NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number, Serial]});
  281: 	Other ->
  282: 	    exit({unexpected_binary_to_term_result, Other})
  283:     end.
  284: 
  285: port_tag(Num, Creation) when 0 =< Num, Num =< ?OLD_MAX_PIDS_PORTS, Creation =< 3 ->
  286:     ?PORT_EXT;
  287: port_tag(Num, _Creation) when 0 =< Num, Num =< ?OLD_MAX_PIDS_PORTS ->
  288:     ?NEW_PORT_EXT;
  289: port_tag(_Num, _Creation) ->
  290:     ?V4_PORT_EXT.
  291: 
  292: mk_port({NodeName, Creation}, Number) when is_atom(NodeName) ->
  293:     <<?VERSION_MAGIC, NodeNameExt/binary>> = term_to_binary(NodeName),
  294:     mk_port({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number);
  295: mk_port({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number) ->
  296:     case catch binary_to_term(list_to_binary([?VERSION_MAGIC,
  297: 					      port_tag(Number, Creation),
  298: 					      NodeNameExt,
  299: 					      case Number > ?OLD_MAX_PIDS_PORTS of
  300: 						  true -> uint64_be(Number);
  301: 						  false -> uint32_be(Number)
  302: 					      end,
  303: 					      enc_creation(Creation)])) of
  304: 	Port when is_port(Port) ->
  305: 	    Port;
  306: 	{'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  307: 	    exit({badarg, mk_port, [{NodeNameExt, Creation}, Number]});
  308: 	Other ->
  309: 	    exit({unexpected_binary_to_term_result, Other})
  310:     end.
  311: 
  312: ref_tag(Creation) when Creation =< 3 -> ?NEW_REFERENCE_EXT;
  313: ref_tag(_Creation) -> ?NEWER_REFERENCE_EXT.
  314: 
  315: mk_ref({NodeName, Creation}, Numbers) when is_atom(NodeName),
  316:                                            is_integer(Creation),
  317:                                            is_list(Numbers) ->
  318:     <<?VERSION_MAGIC, NodeNameExt/binary>> = term_to_binary(NodeName),
  319:     mk_ref({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Numbers);
  320: mk_ref({NodeNameExt, Creation}, [Number]) when is_binary(NodeNameExt),
  321: 					       is_integer(Creation),
  322: 					       Creation =< 3,
  323: 					       is_integer(Number) ->
  324:     case catch binary_to_term(list_to_binary([?VERSION_MAGIC,
  325:                                               ?REFERENCE_EXT,
  326:                                               NodeNameExt,
  327:                                               uint32_be(Number),
  328:                                               uint8(Creation)])) of
  329:         Ref when is_reference(Ref) ->
  330:             Ref;
  331:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  332:             exit({badarg, mk_ref, [{NodeNameExt, Creation}, [Number]]});
  333:         Other ->
  334:             exit({unexpected_binary_to_term_result, Other})
  335:     end;
  336: mk_ref({NodeNameExt, Creation}, Numbers) when is_binary(NodeNameExt),
  337:                                               is_integer(Creation),
  338:                                               is_list(Numbers) ->
  339:     case catch binary_to_term(list_to_binary([?VERSION_MAGIC,
  340: 					      ref_tag(Creation),
  341: 					      uint16_be(length(Numbers)),
  342: 					      NodeNameExt,
  343: 					      enc_creation(Creation),
  344: 					      lists:map(fun (N) ->
  345: 								uint32_be(N)
  346: 							end,
  347: 							Numbers)])) of
  348: 	Ref when is_reference(Ref) ->
  349: 	    Ref;
  350: 	{'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  351: 	    exit({badarg, mk_ref, [{NodeNameExt, Creation}, Numbers]});
  352: 	Other ->
  353: 	    exit({unexpected_binary_to_term_result, Other})
  354:     end.
  355: 
  356: 
  357: 
  358: unicode_atom_data() ->
  359:     [uc_atup(lists:seq(16#1f600, 16#1f600+254)),
  360:      uc_atup(lists:seq(16#1f600, 16#1f600+63)),
  361:      uc_atup(lists:seq(1, 255)),
  362:      uc_atup(lists:seq(100, 163)),
  363:      uc_atup(lists:seq(200, 354)),
  364:      uc_atup(lists:seq(200, 263)),
  365:      uc_atup(lists:seq(2000, 2254)),
  366:      uc_atup(lists:seq(2000, 2063)),
  367:      uc_atup(lists:seq(65500, 65754)),
  368:      uc_atup(lists:seq(65500, 65563))
  369:      | lists:map(fun (N) ->
  370:                          Pow2 = (1 bsl N),
  371:                          uc_atup(lists:seq(Pow2 - 127, Pow2 + 127))
  372:                  end,
  373:                  lists:seq(7, 20))
  374:     ].
  375: 
  376: uc_atup(ATxt) ->
  377:     string_to_atom(ATxt).
  378: 
  379: string_to_atom(String) ->
  380:     Utf8List = string_to_utf8_list(String),
  381:     Len = length(Utf8List),
  382:     TagLen = case Len < 256 of
  383:                  true -> [119, Len];
  384:                  false -> [118, Len bsr 8, Len band 16#ff]
  385:              end,
  386:     binary_to_term(list_to_binary([131, TagLen, Utf8List])).
  387: 
  388: string_to_utf8_list([]) ->
  389:     [];
  390: string_to_utf8_list([CP|CPs]) when is_integer(CP),
  391:                                    0 =< CP,
  392:                                    CP =< 16#7F ->
  393:     [CP | string_to_utf8_list(CPs)];
  394: string_to_utf8_list([CP|CPs]) when is_integer(CP),
  395:                                    16#80 =< CP,
  396:                                    CP =< 16#7FF ->
  397:     [16#C0 bor (CP bsr 6),
  398:      16#80 bor (16#3F band CP)
  399:      | string_to_utf8_list(CPs)];
  400: string_to_utf8_list([CP|CPs]) when is_integer(CP),
  401:                                    16#800 =< CP,
  402:                                    CP =< 16#FFFF ->
  403:     [16#E0 bor (CP bsr 12),
  404:      16#80 bor (16#3F band (CP bsr 6)),
  405:      16#80 bor (16#3F band CP)
  406:      | string_to_utf8_list(CPs)];
  407: string_to_utf8_list([CP|CPs]) when is_integer(CP),
  408:                                    16#10000 =< CP,
  409:                                    CP =< 16#10FFFF ->
  410:     [16#F0 bor (CP bsr 18),
  411:      16#80 bor (16#3F band (CP bsr 12)),
  412:      16#80 bor (16#3F band (CP bsr 6)),
  413:      16#80 bor (16#3F band CP)
  414:      | string_to_utf8_list(CPs)].
